analyzed: de nas phyogs mtshams brgyad dang / lha mo brgyad bsam par bya ste /
translated: Then one should visualize the eight directions and intermediate directions and the eight goddesses.

analyzed: de la 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma'i shar gyi 'dab ma la rnam par gzigs ma /
translated: On the eastern petal of the eight-petaled lotus, one should visualize Tārā,

original: dkar mo padma dmar po bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: dkar mo padma dmar po bsnams pa'o //
translated: white, holding a red lotus.

translated: On the southern petal, one should visualize Tārā, green, holding an utpala.🔽On the western petal, one should visualize Iśvarī, yellow, holding a blue utpala.

analyzed: byang gi 'dab ma la khro gnyer can dkar mo padma ser po bsnams pa'o //
translated: On the northern petal, one should visualize Bhṛkuṭī, white, holding a yellow lotus.

analyzed: shar gyi mtshams kyi padma'i 'dab ma la gnas ma ser mo btsod lta bu'i padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: On the petal in the eastern direction is Padmini, yellow like vermilion, holding a lotus.

original: lho phyogs kyi mtshams kyi 'dab ma la padma'i dbang phyug nam mkha'i mdog lta bu padma dkar po bsnams pa'o //🔽nub phyogs kyi mtshams kyi 'dab ma la sna tshogs padma dkar po padma nag po bsnams pa'o //

translated: On the petal in the southern direction is Padmadhara, the color of the sky, holding a white lotus.🔽On the petal in the western direction is Sitakamalavikaṭa, holding a black lotus.

original: byang phyogs kyi mtshams kyi 'dab ma la sna tshogs rdo rje ma sna tshogs kyi padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi mtshams kyi 'dab ma la sna tshogs rdo rje ma sna tshogs kyi padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: On the petal in the northern direction is Viśvavajra, holding a variegated lotus.

original: 'di thams cad ni skyil mo krung can phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni skyil mo krung can phyag gnyis pa /
translated: All of them are in the vajra posture, with two arms,

original: zhal gcig pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhal gcig pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: one face, and are peaceful.

original: ze'u 'bru'i dbus su 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //🔽aom hr'i:padma na rte shva ra h'um /

translated: In the center of the pericarp is the Blessed One, Ārya Avalokiteśvara, the nature of great passion.

original: zhes bya ba bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should recite: Oṃ hrīḥ padmanarteśvara hūṃ.

analyzed: padma gar dbang gi sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa rdzogs so //
translated: The means of achieving Padmanarteśvara, taught by the perfect Buddha, is complete.
